alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 11:19AM EST until further notice by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. For the Maple River...including Maple Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maple River at Maple Rapids. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of County Line Road and a home along County Line Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening and crest around 9.3 feet Thursday. The river is then expected to remain near steady through Saturday before slowly falling. There is a possibility that ice jams could form along the river. Any ice jam formation could cause rapid rise in the vicinity of the jam. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 11/02/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
